introduction: lists are used to store multiple items in a single variable.
lists are one of 4 built-in data types in python used to store collections of data. a list can contain any datatype, even different datatypes.
the items of a list are always in order and it is very easy to add, change or remove elements of a list.
subintroduction: another way to create a list is by using the list() method, which takes only one input.
exercise_description: a list can contain items with different datatypes. create a list which contains the integer 1, the string 'one' and the boolean true, in this order, using sqaure brackets. name it one and print it.

hints.text: to create a list by using square brackets write:
